ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: What is the matter with you? On what basis do you judge?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: What has come upon you that you judge in such a wise?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: What is the matter with you? How ill do you judge!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: What is the matter with you? How could you judge this to be so?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: What is the matter with you? What sort of a judgement you impose!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: What is the matter with you How judge you
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: What has happened to you? How do you judge?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What ails you then, how you judge?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: What aileth you? How foolishly ye judge!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: What ails you? How ill you judge!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: What aileth you? How ill ye judge!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: What is the matter with you? How do you judge!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: What is the matter with you? How judge ye?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: What is the matter with you? How judge you?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What is the matter with you then, how do you judge?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:36] What is wrong with you? How do you judge?, with such corrupt judgement?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (What aileth you) people of Mecca? (How foolishly ye judge!) Evil is what you judge for yourselves!
